body.name: ThermoPro Twin TempSpike Wireless Meat Thermometer with 2 Meat Probes, 500FT Bluetooth Meat Thermometer with LCD-Enhanced Booster for Turkey Beef Rotisserie BBQ Grill Oven Smoker Thermometer
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 6 hrs 54 mins
features: Industry-Leading Bluetooth 500FT Range: Using the most advanced 5.2 Bluetooth technology, the TempSpike line offers the only wireless thermometers on the market that can monitor food temperatures up to 500 feet away(unobstructed)for a dynamic cooking environment

Booster with Standalone Display: Check the ambient and meat temperatures on the Booster display without the Smart App; Backlight LCD allows you to cook in dim-light condition, making checking your food easier than ever

Twin Probes, Dual Sensors: This Bluetooth thermometer for cooking features two wireless meat probes, each equipped with separate sensors, which help you get a comprehensive idea of your eats’ internal/ambient temperatures

100% Wire-Free: Unlike other food thermometers and their fussy wires, this wireless cooking thermometer features a fully wire-free design without tangles or stretching cords, making it more versatile and easier to use, perfect for rotisserie, oven, grill, smoker, and more

Smart App Control: With the TempSpike App, you can monitor the estimated cooking time, preset desired temperatures, and receive alerts from your phone, get access to all the cooking stats you could possibly need as the Twin TempSpike sits adhered to your steak inside the oven

productInformation.name: Included Components
productInformation.value: Two probes, one booster, one USB-C charging cable, one user manual

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Looked at all the options available for a remote meat probe.These seemed the best as the base shows charge level and temp on a LCD screen, I simply place the base near the oven or grill and watch it versus the phone app.The app works as I expected it too and everything connected easily.The range isn’t very far so be aware you can’t go to the other end of the house without loosing connection but as soon as your back in range it’s reconnected no problem for me.Used them at thanksgiving and Christmas plus a couple other holiday meals and I’m very happy.I love the double probes especially for the turkey as I put one in the breast and one in the thigh for a more accurate picture. Bird came out perfect when they both read 165. It’s also nice to not have to guess at steak doneness anymore!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The wireless meat thermometer with a dedicated app is a game-changer for any kitchen. The convenience of monitoring temperatures remotely via Wi-Fi adds a new level of flexibility to the cooking process. The app's user-friendly interface and real-time updates make it easy to achieve precision in grilling or roasting. This smart kitchen gadget seamlessly blends technology with culinary expertise, ensuring your meals are cooked to perfection without being tethered to the oven.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Accurate for meat but ambient temperature reading takes a while
reviews.reviewText: Update to my review below: Seems as though the more I use the probes, the faster they are able to read the ambient temperature. After about five uses, they now read fairly accurately after about 1 to 2 hours. I increased my overall rating from 3 to 4 stars.Original Review: These wireless meat thermometers are very accurate (for meat only - see below), have a long lasting battery and have a great wireless range. I bought them for the range and I liked the idea of monitoring both meat and ambient temperatures at the same time fro the same probe. I have used them twice so far, once for smoking/cooking an 8lb brisket and then to smoke/cook a chuck roast to make some burnt ends - both using indirect heat and smoke trays in my natural gas BBQ. The battery was good for the entire 14 hour smoke/cook for the brisket!. The only problem is that the ceramic tip takes at least 5 or 6 hours or more to heat up before it will give a reasonably accurate ambient temperature reading, which makes this feature worthless to me. The app works great and I can get readings while I'm almost anywhere in my house. I gave it only 3 stars overall and for accuracy because of the ambient temperature issue. I like being able to charge the base unit using a USB-C connector.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best thermometer I’ve owned
reviews.reviewText: Works great not sure about 500’ transmission distance. I do receive a good signal indoor through several interior walls at roughly 75’. The internal food temp is dead on accurate. Great programable features for gems and warnings. The time till done estimate is very accurate also and updates should you raise or lower your cooking temperature. I have owned several other brands some in the same price range by far this is the best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really like using this product. Easy to use and clean. Very accurate. Even bought one for my son. He loves it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wireless works great!
reviews.reviewText: ThermoPro customer service is great. One probe stopped working after three months. ThermoPro replaced the unit with a new one in less than a week

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Dropping to 1 star.
reviews.reviewText: After my 3rd Meater+ went bad, I decided to give this device a shot. First, I would endorse this over the prior device for various reasons, but there is one hiccup keeping it from being a 5-star.The problem:The black probe seems to disconnect randomly. I’ve made sure it is positioned where it doesn’t accidentally touch grill grates, fully charged the battery, and cleaned it spotless prior to every use (carbon build up created signal problems with former devices). I’ve used it separately, and on the same piece of meat and for whatever reason it tends to drop. The receiver and app just show: “ - - -“. I can’t ever seem to get it to reconnect once it does this. At least there’s a second spike as a backup. The black spike seems to read lower than the white spike in all scenarios too, but there could be differences in ambient temps due to placement or internal meat temp due to thickness of the cut and so forth. I’m willing to give these guys4 stars right now but not 5 because i primarily use the white spike only as a result of the weirdness with the black - which essentials it a single spike, which is what I was replacing/moving away from. I’d like it if the seller would reach out to discuss solutions/replacements is necessary. Good customer service would be the difference in a 5 star upgrade, or a downgrade to 3 stars.The good (there a lot):1. Dual spikes give more accurate realtime cook info than competitor’s single spike devices for the same price point.2. Spikes are MUCH more robust than previous devices3. Remote docking station is extremely better build/designed than competitor devices in that you’re not tied to using an app that gives you problems mid-cook.4. Battery life is better than previous devices5. Signal range: I can go inside my house from the first floor deck and down into the basement for prolonged periods without losing signal - basement was absolutely not an option on previous devices.6. Docking station isn’t “wood” - my dogs love to chew wood. They chewed two other previous devices up badly. Also, would is porous, so water and food stains are a thing.7. Docking station is rechargeable - previous devices used batteries, and ran through them at an absurd cadence to boot.8. Docking station is backlit - huge advantage during early morning/late evening/night cooks.9. Spike don’t have a “cap” over the transmitter that you can wiggle off during cleaning.10. Overall design lends itself to ease of cleaning more than previous devices11. My wife can pick it up and use it easily in the kitchen without having to be shackled to an app on my phone to tell the temps.In general, I’m happy with this unit and will be using it for the foreseeable future, while the black probe gets wonky sometimes- it’s not every time. That part could be better (hint hint seller), but in general this is a significant upgrade from the previous device I was replacing which also randomly disconnected for various reasons, had poor battery life, shackled you to apps that acted up, and unfortunately attracted the attention of my two dogs when no one was looking.Update 2 months in the black probe has completely crapped out. It’s a brick. Zero response acknowledgment from seller to the original post. No way to get help or ask questions. I just wanted a replacement black probe. The lack of response or engagement feels like commitment to customer experience or quality. Maybe I’ll go back to Meater2+ since it handles temps up to 900+ now. This thing is junk. Bluetooth range has diminished to about 14 feet. Doesn’t send signals through the walls anymore. Doesn’t check any of the original boxes, and the black prob died right in the middle of cooking the Christmas prime rib. I gave these guys a shot and got burned. For the price, it should last longer than 60 days. Since buying and reviewing it, I’ve noticed spikes very similar popping up on other “me-too” devices. I absolutely can’t recommend this thing. “Buyer beware” if you choose to roll the dice on it.Update again mid-cook. Black probe started working but is giving bizarre readings. Analog thermometer that’s always reasonably accurate says 300, white probe says 282, black probe says 143. Oddly the IT on the black is higher than the white by 30 degrees too. Can’t trust that kinda output.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are awesome
reviews.reviewText: I have used these several times now and they seem to be very accurate. I have done chicken and multiple tri tips and roast. I have not had anything undercooked or over cooked yet. I have double checked using an instant 1 touch thermometer and the temps are pretty accurate within a degree or 2. I cooked a whole turkey on the smoker on Christmas using these wireless probes. It was about 5hrs cook time and these probes were accurate and stayed charged the entire time.

This product is exactly what I was looking for. I am an avid BBQ Guy ... I've tried many things to assist with consistent BBQ results. This product was a big help assisting with those consistent results.Easy to setup and use is an understatement. It was flawless.Accuracy is a must in my BBQ and this device performs flawlessly. It is actually more than I expected. I now use it both for BBQ and indoor oven. I am glad I made this purchase.Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: great for turkey and roasts in the oven.
reviews.reviewText: has reading in the therm holder as well as an app on phone.
Having two probes are great use all the time

That’s the photo after just one use. White one looks likes it’s years old and not taken care of. Temp went from 88 to 158 in 30 seconds. Both probes in one piece of meat and the temp difference between the two was 50F. Ambient temperature was 100f difference. This is just a crap product. This is going back today.

Probe seemed to work well but Bluetooth range between the booster and my cell was horrible. I was getting disconnected alarms which were really innaproriates inside my house which was like less than 30ft. Also, I was getting the same disconneted alarm everytime I was talking on the phone. The beeper was so intrusive that I had to stop my calls to cancel this alarm. annowing. My next wireless Thermometer must have wi-fi connexion which resolve all range issues. Also, I didn't like the graph recording option as I had to start it manually and it was stopping everytime I was loosing my connexion. I do have a wired no connexion to my cell Thermopro that I really like. This was the reason to buy this brand upfront.
